III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to: (ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 7/11/23, there was an altercation between youth and staff. It is
unknown what happened or what led to the altercation, but youth
was reading a book, slammed it shut and got up. It is unknown
what happened then, but during the altercation, staff "choked"
youth. There were no injuries to youth.
Investigation On 7/13/23 an in-person meeting was held with Youth A at
CFC. He was not interviewed about the incident due to pending
law enforcement involvement. Youth A presented well, and no
marks or bruises were observed. Youth A briefly spoke about the
incident between him and the staff. Youth A did not report he had
been chocked by Residential Program Operations Manager
(RPOM) or any other staff. On 07/26/2023 an in-person meeting
was held with Youth A at Clerance Fischer Center (CFC). DHHS
specialist was also present. Youth A reported he was in Unit 4
laying on his bed reading a book. He stated he decided he was
going to walk out of the back door, but Staff 2 and another staff
that he does not recall blocked him. He reported he became more
upset and began to kick the doors leading to the case managers
office. He said the door popped open and Supervisor 3 tried to
stop him from going in, but he still got into the office and went
inside and closed the door. Youth A reported RPOM and
Supervisor 4 came into the office and tried to calm him down by
talking to him. He stated he became more upset because he felt
staff were trying to block him in. Youth A stated Supervisor 1
came to help and “all hell broke loose”. Youth A stated he was
trying to get out of the office and admitted to throwing things,
throwing plastic shelves and pushing up against the staff. He
stated he heard RPOM counting down from three and then told
staff to restrain him. He reported Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 4
2

began to restrain him. Youth A admitted to fighting the restraint by
pushing back and reported when he tried to go to the ground, the
staff would let him go. Youth A reported he got up and began to
throw more things at the staff. He stated he had a piece of broken
plastic he was acting like he was going to hit staff with and when
RPOM and Supervisor 4 grabbed it, they got cut. Youth A
reported he was restrained again, and staff pushed down on is
back and had one arm behind him. He was unable to recall who
these staff were. Youth A reported he attempted to get out the
door again and RPOM pushed him against the wall and put her
arm to his throat. Youth A first stated he wasn’t able to breathe
and then stated he barely could breathe. He reported he was
gasping for air but was able to get out of the hold. He stated he
was restrained again (but did not indicate by who) and this is
when he bit RPOM. Youth A stated “so much” occurred that it all
seemed “jumbled” to him. He recalled Supervisor 2 opened the
door and slammed it against him. He recalled he threw a drink on
the floor causing it to explode and pushed out of the office, went to
the back door, and ran outside. Youth A stated he was restrained
a total of four or five times but was unable to indicate which staff
participated in each restraint. Youth A reported staff agreed to
allow him to talk to his mother and brother if he came back inside,
so he agreed. He stated when the police came, he told them
everything that happened including being choked. He stated he
did not tell the doctor he was choked because he was “pissed”.
He reported we should talk with Staff 1 as she was next door in
Unit 3 and heard everything.
On 09/08/2023 an in-person follow up meeting was held with
Youth A at CFC. DHHS specialist was also present. Youth A
confirmed he had bit RPOM but was unable to indicate where he
bit her on her arm. He stated RPOM, Supervisor 1 and
Supervisor 4 were in the room at the time he was choked. Youth
A stated RPOM choked him with her forearm and then stated,
“maybe that’s where I bit her”. He further indicated he was
pushed behind the door but did not identify who pushed him. He
recalled RPOM only had her forearm on his neck for a few
seconds and denied he blacked out. He recalled pushing the face
of RPOM and kicking her in an attempt to get her to stop. He
could not recall how he got away. Youth A denied talking to
anyone else about this incident and what happened, including his
therapist.
On 07/19/23 a telephone call was held with DHHS Specialist. She
provided updates regarding the case. DHHS specialist also
advised she received hospital records and Youth A did not report
3

to the medical team that he was choked. DHHS specialist also
advised she had spoken with Vassar PD Officer who responded to
the scene, and he reported he interviewed all parties and none of
them reported that RPOM choked Youth A. She also reported
that he stated that he would be submitting the report with a
request for Youth A to be charged with felonious assault and that
he feels that Youth A only made the claim that he was choked
after finding out he may be charged criminally. DHHS specialist
indicated she spoke with Doctor at Covenant Hospital, and she
denied Youth A advised her that he was choked during the
examination.
On 7/26/23 an interview was held with complainant. No
additional concerns noted.
On 7/26/23 an in-person meeting was held with Supervisor 3
at CFC. DHHS specialist was also present. She recalled she was
either called to the area to assist or was doing a walk through and
saw the commotion. She noted Youth A was trying to get out of
the unit by kicking doors. She tried to stand in front of the
inventory door (next to the offices) to stop Youth A from kicking it.
She stated he ran and kicked the door and was able to get it
opened, ran in and shut the door. She stated she called for
assistance and RPOM, Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 4 came to
assist. Supervisor 3 stated she began to focus her attention on
Youth E who was trying to get into the room with Youth A. She
stated she was not aware of what was going on in the office
because she was trying to manage Youth E. She recalled hearing
Youth E yelling about wanting to go home. She reported RPOM
sent Supervisor 1 out of the office because Youth A was punching
him. She stated RPOM asked for her to assist in the office. She
stated she witnessed Youth A trying to punch Supervisor 4 and he
also tried to bite her. She and Supervisor 4 tried to place Youth A
in a restraint, but he would go to his knees, and they would
release. She denied ever seeing Youth A on the ground during a
restraint. She stated Supervisor 2 came in the office and Youth A
threw coffee on her and pushed passed them to get out of the
office. She denied they restrained him and stated she and
Supervisor 2 followed him. She stated she agreed to help him find
his mother if he came back into the building. Youth A walked back
to CFC building but made a comment about wanting to kill himself.
She denied Youth A ever reported he was choked and denied
seeing RPOM physically touch Youth A during the incident. She
denied seeing RPOM’s forearm on the neck of Youth A. She
specifically recalled when the switch between her and Supervisor
1 occurred, RPOM was by the door.
4

On 09/13/2023 an in-person follow up meeting was held with
Supervisor 3 at CFC. DHHS specialist was also present.
Supervisor 3 reported when she arrived on the scene of the
incident RPOM, Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 4 were there. Youth
A was hitting Supervisor 1, so RPOM told him to leave the area
and Supervisor 3 went into the office area to help. She reported
she and Supervisor 4 attempted to get Youth A into a standing
restraint without success. She reported Youth A was trying to bite
her and kept falling to the ground. Supervisor 3 stated RPOM was
standing near the wall. She denied seeing RPOM and Supervisor
4 place Youth A into a restraint. She recalled Supervisor 2
entered the room and Youth A threw coffee at her and ran out of
the unit and went outside. Supervisor 3 denied RPOM seemed
upset and denied seeing her place Youth A in a restraint. She
was aware RPOM and Supervisor 2 were dating but denied this
impacts child safety or workplace interactions.
On 07/26/23 a in-person meeting was held with LPN. DHHS
specialist was also present. LPN confirmed she met with Youth A
on 7/12/23. She reported he had a small scratch on his left elbow
and there were no injuries to his neck. He did not report anything
to her about being choked or staff being inappropriate.
On 08/02/23 an in-person meeting was held with RPOM at
CFC. DHHS specialist was also present. RPOM believed she
was called to the incident via radio. Upon arrival she reported
Youth A was already in the closet of the case manager’s office.
Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 4 were present also. She stated
Youth A was pushing staff and trying to get into the office and they
were attempting to manage the environment by trying to talk to
him to calm him down. She reported Youth A was throwing things
and went to the other office. RPOM reported she was able to
push the door open and Supervisor 2 and Supervisor 3 came to
help. She recalled Youth A began to break plastic shelves and
had a piece of it in his hand and started to punch Supervisor 1.
She reported Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 4 placed Youth A in a
restraint, and she tried to get the plastic from his hands. She
reported Youth A was fighting the restraint and ended up biting
her upper right arm. She stated she took her hands and placed
them on his chest area and as he was backing up against the wall.
RPOM demonstrated the motion she took with her hands. Based
on the demonstration and verbal report of RPOM, it was not
described as a push. She stated her hands were on his chest and
not close or near his neck. She stated Youth A did not actually
bite her and only got her shirt, stating he did not break the skin.
5

RPOM stated Youth A was only restrained one time and she was
not involved in it. She denied her arm or hand were near or on
Youth A’s neck.
Youth A bolted out the back door and ran into the woods, followed
by Supervisor 3. RPOM stated Youth A immediately begin saying
he was choked by her, but she denied this occurred. She stated
he kept saying “y’all choked me”. RPOM stated she backed off as
she seemed to now be a trigger for Youth A. She reported he has
since wanted to talk to her, but she has kept her distance since
there is a safety plan in place. On 09/08/2023 an in-person follow
up meeting was held with RPOM at CFC. DHHS specialist was
also present. At the request of RPOM, Human Resources
representative also sat in on the meeting. RPOM confirmed Youth
A bit her on her upper right shoulder. She could not recall what
her actions were right after but knows she did not leave the area.
She believed at this time only Supervisor 3 was in the room. She
again stated she was not ever in a restraint with Youth A. She
recalled Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 4 put Youth A in a restraint
after he was attempting to hit staff. She denied her forearm was
ever on the neck of Youth A. She admitted to having her hands
on his chest in an attempt to calm him down. She stated she was
doing protective interventions like moving things in the room and
standing in front of the doors. RPOM stated she is not sure why
others would report seeing her with her forearm against Youth A’s
neck. She stated she is a supervisor and holds staff accountable
and they sometimes don’t like that. RPOM denied ever being in
trouble for being aggressive or performing an inappropriate
restraint. She reported receiving a verbal write up for having a
verbal altercation with a supervisor many years ago.
On 08/02/2023 an in-person meeting was held with Youth B at
CFC. DHHS specialist was also present. He denied Youth A told
him he was choked or that staff did something to Youth A. Youth
B further denied ever seeing staff do anything inappropriate to
Youth A. Youth B described RPOM as one of the “stricter staff”
that doesn’t take “bull crap”. He further denied Youth A mentioned
anything to him about the incident with RPOM.
On 08/02/2023 an in-person meeting was held with Youth C at
CFC. DHHS specialist was also present. Youth C denied seeing
what happened. He recalled he and Youth E were trying to see
what was going on, but staff (that he couldn’t recall) were in the
way. He admitted he later heard Youth A say several times he
was choked but knows that it did not happen because he was right
6

there. He denied Youth A had any injuries to his neck and denied
he initially said he was choked when coming out of the office.
On 08/02/2023 an in-person meeting was held with Staff 1 at
CFC. DHHS specialist was also present. Staff 1 expressed
concern to be interviewed as she was concerned about
“retaliation”. Staff 1 denied she was in the area when the incident
occurred, but was in Unit 3. She recalled hearing Youth A yelling
and things being thrown around. She confirmed at no point could
her or the other youth in the room see anything occurring in the
office. She stated, however, she could hear gargling coming from
the office as if someone was being choked. Staff 1 reported she
later saw Youth A and asked if he was ok, and he said “no”. He
said he no longer wanted to be at the facility and staff was choking
him. He failed to identify which “staff” he was referring to. Staff 1
reported Youth D also heard it. Staff 1 again reiterated her
concern about retaliation for being honest. She stated there are
no cameras in the area of the incident with Youth A. She reported
she has been written up since the incident happened when she
told another staff, whom she failed to identify, about it. Staff 1
stated after DCWL’s last visit and notification to her she needed to
be interviewed, Supervisor 1 came up to her and said, “you look
real guilty right now”. She stated all of the supervisors date each
other and staff can’t go to them with an issue because they all
cover for each other. She specifically indicated RPOM and
Supervisor 2 are dating each other. Staff 1 denied seeing RPOM
be inappropriate with youth prior to this incident.
On 08/02/2023 an in-person meeting was held with the Case
Manager (CM). DHHS specialist was also present. She reported
she has been working with Youth A since April 2023. She denied
she was in the area when the incident occurred. She denied
Youth A telling her he was choked, and she only heard of the
allegation from others discussing it. She reported she is unsure if
Youth A has made allegations in the past regarding other staff
being inappropriate or physically aggressive with him.
On 08/16/2023 a video conference meeting occurred with
Youth D. He and DHHS specialist were at the home of his new
placement in Holland, MI. He recalled Youth A was attempting to
get through a room and was busting down doors and throwing
things around the room. He reported he heard Youth A yelling
“get off me”. He said Youth A later ran out of the office and into
the woods. He denied hearing staff and stated it was very loud in
the room they were in. Youth D denied hearing Youth A say he
was choked. He heard a something but indicated he could “not”
7

define a choking sound and that it could have been heavy
breathing. He stated he was not comfortable saying he could hear
a choking sound, saying it was not clear. He denied ever seeing
any staff including RPOM do anything inappropriate.
On 08/16/2023 a phone call was held with DHHS specialist.
She advised as she was walking back to the house with Youth D
he stated both Supervisor 2 and RPOM were hurt after the
incident with Youth A. He stated it “could” have been choking
noises, but they were behind a shut door, and he can’t say for
certain.
On 08/24/2023 an in-person meeting was held with Youth E at
Bay County Juvenile Home. DHHS specialist was also present.
He stated there are no cameras in the area where the incident
took place. He stated he was trying to “get to” Youth A because
he was upset Youth A threw coffee on Supervisor 2 but could not
get into the room because staff was holding him back. He could
not recall who the staff was. He reported being able to see into
the room where the staff and Youth A were. He denied seeing
any staff choke Youth A and denied Youth A ever told him he was
choked.
On 09/06/2023 an in-person meeting was held with Staff 2 at
CFC. DHHS specialist was also present. She confirmed she was
present for the incident but does not fully remember. She stated
Youth A was attempting to leave the unit and she blocked the door
along with Supervisor 3. Youth A kicked in the closet door of the
office and RPOM and Supervisor 1 came to assist. She stated
Supervisor 1 and RPOM went into the office area, and she did not.
She denied being able to see or hear anything going on in the
office. Staff 2 reported she was attempting to keep Youth E from
trying to enter the office area. She denied Youth E would have
been able to see into the office area. She denied Youth A ever
made any allegations to her about being choked. Staff 2 did not
express any concerns about staff being “clicky” and feel the
environment is appropriate among staff.
On 09/06/2023 an in-person meeting was held with Staff 3 at
CFC. DHHS specialist was also present. She recalled Youth A
kicked the closet door open and ended up in the office area. She
stated Supervisor 3 came into the area to assist. Youth A kicked
open another door and Supervisor 3 and Supervisor 4 came to the
area to assist. She recalled a lot was going on and she was trying
to keep Youth B and Youth E calm. She stated she could not see
what was going on in the office area. She reported being able to
8

hear Youth A throwing things around in the office and saw
Supervisor 2 come out of the office with coffee on her, which left
RPOM, Youth A and another staff in the office. She was unable to
recall who the other staff was. She also reported hearing Youth A
yell “get off of me” and “I can’t breathe”. She described his
screaming as “horrific”. She stated she was not sure if he said he
was being choked. Staff 3 reported she was asked by RPOM to
move the other youth out of the unit, but reported she and the
youth did not feel safe doing so. She stated Youth E did not think
Youth A was safe. She reported Youth A went out the back door
and she has never heard him yell the way he was that day. She
stated he immediately said he was choked when he came out.
She stated Youth A was treated by an ambulance, and he kept
crying and stating he thought he was going to die. She denied
knowing why the ambulance was treating Youth A. Staff 3 denied
ever seeing RPOM be inappropriate with youth before. She
stated she believed staff and youth in the unit would have heard
what was going on and identified them as Youth D and Staff 1.
Staff 3 reported the staff are “clicky” and she does not feel
comfortable going to supervision to report concerns, stating you
“can’t go to the police about the police”. She denied she feels the
relationships between staff have an impact on child safety.
On 09/06/2023 an in-person meeting was held with Supervisor
1 at CFC. DHHS specialist was also present. He did not recall
why Youth A was upset, but recalled getting a call to assist
because Youth A was kicking doors in the unit. He recalled
RPOM, Staff 3 and Case Manager (CM) were present. CM
opened the door to the office where Youth A had run into. He
recalled Youth A was throwing things around the office.
Supervisor 1 also recalled Youth E was upset with Youth A
because he pushed RPOM. He denied Youth E was in the office.
Supervisor 4 came to assist, and Youth A was breaking plastic
shelves and pushing staff. He reported he and Supervisor 4
attempted to place Youth A into a high standing hold, but Youth A
would drop to the ground, and they would release. Supervisor 1
reported he was being targeted by Youth A and he was punched
in the face several times. He stated he was instructed to leave by
RPOM and is unsure if Youth A was placed in another restraint.
He believed Supervisor 3 came to assist. Supervisor 1 stated he
never returned to the area. He denied speaking with Youth A
about the incident. He recalled RPOM came out of the office and
stated Youth A made an allegation that she choked him.
Supervisor 1 denied ever seeing RPOM be aggressive with other
youth.
9

On 09/13/2023 an in-person follow up meeting was held with
Supervisor 1 at CFC. DHHS specialist was also present.
Supervisor 1 confirmed he wrote the incident report relative to the
incident although he was not present for the entire time. He
reported asking the other staff that were present what occurred so
he could document it into the report. He stated he believed Youth
A was placed in two separate restraints on this day and most of
staff actions were attempting to control the environment. He
denied seeing RPOM place Youth A into a restraint and stated
only he and Supervisor 4 placed Youth A in a restraint to his
knowledge. He also denied seeing RPOM place her hands on the
chest of Youth A. He denied knowing if any of the youth care
workers and supervisors are dating. He reported being aware of
RPOM and Supervisor 2 dating and further advised he and
Clinical Director are dating. He reported he does not feel the staff
relationships have any impact on job performance or child safety.
On 09/06/2023 an in-person meeting was held with Supervisor
2 at CFC. DHHS specialist was also present. She reported she
was walking through the lodge, heard commotion and went to see
what was going on. She found Youth A in the office with RPOM,
Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 4. Supervisor 2 said she did not
remember a lot of the details as to what happened. She reported
Youth E was upset because of the things Youth A was doing to
staff and was trying to get to him. Supervisor 2 stated staff were
working to keep the youth separated. She reported Youth A threw
coffee on her and then walked out of the office. She denied
seeing Youth A in a restraint and denied hearing him say anything
other than “move” and “let me out”. Supervisor 2 denied ever
hearing Youth A say he was choked. She denied she and RPOM
were ever alone with Youth A in the office and is not sure where
this allegation came from.
On 09/06/2023 an in-person meeting was held with Supervisor
4 at CFC. DHHS specialist was also present. Supervisor 4
reported he was called to the unit to assist and upon arrival Youth
A was already escalated. He entered the office and RPOM and
Supervisor 1 was present. Youth A was throwing and breaking
things around the office. He reported he and Supervisor 1 placed
Youth A in a standing hold. Youth A was fighting the restraint and
was able to get loose on the side of Supervisor 1 and began to
punch him. Supervisor 1 then left the area and Supervisor 3 came
in to assist. Youth A continued with his behavior and was placed
in another restraint by Supervisor 4 and RPOM. Youth A
attempted to bite RPOM, and this is when she pushed him back
toward the wall with her forearm against his throat. He stated
10

prior to this happening, RPOM was in an incorrect stance (in front
of the youth) for a restraint, which caused her to struggle with the
restraint of Youth A. He reported Youth A stated, “you’re chocking
me”. He said her arm was there for a very short time, likely one or
two seconds, stating it happened fast. He stated he tapped
RPOM on the shoulder to get her to put her arm down.
Supervisor 4 reported anyone outside of the door should have
been able to hear what was going on. He reported Supervisor 3
was also present when RPOM had her arms on Youth A’s neck.
Prior to running out of the room, Youth A said to Supervisor 4 “you
saw what she did”. Supervisor 4 denied talking to RPOM about
the incident and confirmed he did not report it to anyone. He
stated he thinks she took this action in reflex to getting bit. He
stated RPOM is his supervisor, so he questioned who he was to
tell. He reported he is a CPI trainer and the actions by RPOM are
not consistent with CPI protocol. He denied seeing RPOM be
inappropriate with youth previously.
On 09/08/2023 an in-person follow up meeting was held with
Supervisor 4 at CFC. DHHS specialist was also present. He
confirmed he never saw Youth A bite RPOM but saw him go
toward her like he was going to bite her. He thought it was near
the arm, but stated he was unable to confirm the area. He did
note that the possible bite occurred prior to RPOM putting her
forearm against Youth A’s neck. He further confirmed Youth A
was placed in more than one restraint on that day. He reported
RPOM and Supervisor 1 were all involved in a restraint at one
time with Youth A. He reported once Supervisor 1 left the room,
he did not return. Supervisor 4 said Youth A had a broken piece
of plastic in his hand that he was threatening staff with. They told
him to put it down, he refused and attempted to punch RPOM.
Youth A was placed into another restraint by him and RPOM.
Supervisor 4 denied Supervisor 2 was present for any of the
restraints and denied Youth A attempted to bite any other staff.
On 11/9/2023 and 11/13/2023 attempts were made to contact
Supervisor 4 for follow up interview questions. CA advised that
Supervisor 4 was no longer employed with CFC, but provided his
personal cell phone number. Several attempts were made to
contact Supervisor 4 to further inquire about discrepancies in his
report to law enforcement and his report to DHHS specialist and
DCWL consultant. Attempts to reach Supervisor 4 via telephone
or text message were unsuccessful.
11

Documents Reviewed:
Nurse Contact Sheet/Nursing Note for Youth A – He was seen
24 hours after the incident. Only superficial bruising to left elbow
was noted, no other marks. There was no report of choking made
by Youth A.
Incident Report – Completed for 7/11/23 and did not indicate that
any choking occurred and also noted “no injuries” for Youth A.
Police Report – Documented that the following staff were
interviewed: Youth A, Supervisor 1, Supervisor 2, Supervisor 3
and Supervisor 4, and RPOM. The verbal reports of all staff
denied seeing or having knowledge of RPOM choking Youth A.
All of the above mentioned, with the exception of Youth A, also
provided a written statement. None of the written statements
indicate that RPOM used physical discipline with Youth A or
choked him. Youth A reported in his police statement that he was
trying to get out of the office and was pushing RPOM. He stated
this is when she put her arm against his neck. Officer noted no
red marks or discoloration to the neck of Youth A.
Viewed Unit Four and Office Space- No one would have been
able to see into the room the incident took place in from the other
unit.
Covenant House Medical Records – Youth A was seen on the
night of the incident and did not report to medical staff that he was
choked.
HR File of RPOM – No disciplinary action within the last five
years. Unable to locate in file, however RPOM reported a verbal
reprimand approximately 8 years ago as a result of a verbal
altercation with management.
WHS Workplace Relationship/Nepotism Policy - Employees
involved in a consensual relationship (mutually agreed upon
romantic or sexual relationship) are encouraged to advise
management. Upon review of the circumstances, management
will take steps to see that the reporting or supervision structure is
changed if necessary or take similar steps to protect both parties
and the work environment.
WHS Supervisor assignments – Review of current assignment
documents and assignments are appropriate and do not violate
Nepotism/Workplace Relationship policy.
Analysis During interviews it was determined that Youth A, Supervisor 1,
Supervisor 2, Supervisor 3, Supervisor 4 and the RPOM were in
the office area at some point during the timeframe Youth A
disclosed being choked. Youth A reported RPOM put her forearm
to his throat, choking him. This was consistent with his report to
law enforcement following the incident. Law enforcement noted to
DHHS specialist that Youth A made this claim after being advised
he may be criminally charged for assaulting staff.
12

The police report documented Youth A, Supervisor 1, Supervisor
2, Supervisor 3, Supervisor 4 and RPOM were all interviewed and
all but Youth A provided written statements. The verbal reports of
all staff denied seeing or having knowledge of RPOM choking
Youth A. None of the written statements indicate RPOM used
physical discipline with Youth A or choked him. Youth A reported
he was trying to get out of the office and was pushing RPOM. He
stated during that time, she put his arm against his neck. Officer
noted no red marks or discoloration to the neck of Youth A.
Supervisor 1, Supervisor 2 and Supervisor 3 each reported being
